text: After a weekend dip, the number of people being treated for COVID-19 in Bay Area hospitals ticked up on Tuesday to 504 patients. https://t.co/qHnQoYTfEx

name: sfchronicle
text:
EXCLUSIVE: San Francisco schools are unlikely to send all kids back full-time in August.

But families won’t know for sure until the end of July, less than three weeks before the first day of school. https://t.co/ZhZadVGSPy

text: The death sentence of SF’s only condemned prisoner, Clifford Bolden, was reduced to life with the possibility of parole Tuesday in a plea agreement with DA Chesa Boudin. https://t.co/4xOPlTCZDA

name: sfchronicle
text: Data collected by The Chronicle from California’s counties shows that more than 9,000 new coronavirus cases were reported Tuesday — breaking the record set Monday of 8,638. https://t.co/8Hghk6eooe

text: Data from California’s counties shows that more than 9,000 new coronavirus cases were reported Tuesday — breaking the record set Monday of 8,638. https://t.co/gA05eP4sTZ

name: sfchronicle
text: A Carmel Valley restaurant has been flooded with praise and gifts following a viral video in which a server ordered a man to leave after he made racist remarks and cursed at a family celebrating a birthday on the Fourth of July. https://t.co/RjxHYWzvpo

name: sfchronicle
text: "As soon as they saw me they weren’t hiring me.” @janellebitker interviews seven Black chefs and servers about discrimination in the Bay Area restaurant industry. https://t.co/MHUsoUDECS

name: sfchronicle
text: “(The shooter) had no connection to anybody,” said a family member. “It just appears like he was some psycho who thinks shooting someone is fun.” https://t.co/S8kFk3CVQT

text:
Bay Area public transit, seeing a slow rise in ridership as the economy reopens, are rolling out safety protocols in the hope of luring commuters back. 

Here are the details: https://t.co/bzkt21By3P

name: sfchronicle
text: California is suing to stop a Trump administration regulation that would require states to give more of their federal coronavirus relief money to private schools. https://t.co/yTpdVc9Zx8

name: sfchronicle
text: San Quentin, one of the nation's largest coronavirus outbreak sites, has judges calling for the release of its medically-vulnerable prisoners. Read more: https://t.co/sB0RD4ZyEx

name: sfchronicle
text:
California recorded more than 9,000 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, a record-breaking daily count as the outbreak continues to surge across the state.

Story by @MalloryMoench: https://t.co/ObTcCoeco6
